title: Modified Fisher Grading Scale for Subarachnoid Hemorrhage (SAH)
description: States severity of aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage based on amount and type of blood on CT with associated risk of vasospasm

parameters.name: sah_thickness
parameters.description: Subarachnoid hemorrhage thickness on CT scan

result.name: modified_fisher_grade
result.description: Modified Fisher grade (0-4) with associated vasospasm risk

ranges.interpretation: No subarachnoid hemorrhage detected on CT. Vasospasm risk: 0%.
Focal or diffuse thin SAH (<1mm) without intraventricular hemorrhage. Vasospasm risk: 6-24%.
Focal or diffuse thin SAH (<1mm) with intraventricular hemorrhage. Vasospasm risk: 15-33%.
Focal or diffuse thick SAH (≥1mm) without intraventricular hemorrhage. Vasospasm risk: 33-35%.
Focal or diffuse thick SAH (≥1mm) with intraventricular hemorrhage. Vasospasm risk: 34-40%.

references: Frontera JA, Claassen J, Schmidt JM, Wartenberg KE, Temes R, Connolly ES Jr, MacDonald RL, Mayer SA. Prediction of symptomatic vasospasm after subarachnoid hemorrhage: the modified fisher scale. Neurosurgery. 2006 Jul;59(1):21-7; discussion 21-7. doi: 10.1227/01.NEU.0000218821.34014.1B.

Claassen J, Bernardini GL, Kreiter K, Bates J, Du YE, Copeland D, Connolly ES, Mayer SA. Effect of cisternal and ventricular blood on risk of delayed cerebral ischemia after subarachnoid hemorrhage: the Fisher scale revisited. Stroke. 2001 Sep;32(9):2012-20. doi: 10.1161/hs0901.095677.

Fisher CM, Kistler JP, Davis JM. Relation of cerebral vasospasm to subarachnoid hemorrhage visualized by computerized tomographic scanning. Neurosurgery. 1980 Jan;6(1):1-9. doi: 10.1227/00006123-198001000-00001.
formula: Grade determined by combination of SAH thickness (<1mm vs ≥1mm) and presence/absence of intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH). Grade 0: No SAH. Grade 1: Thin SAH, no IVH. Grade 2: Thin SAH with IVH. Grade 3: Thick SAH, no IVH. Grade 4: Thick SAH with IVH.
notes: Only applies to aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage
Modified Fisher scale is more predictive of vasospasm than original Fisher scale
Thick SAH defined as ≥1mm thickness on CT scan
Thin SAH defined as <1mm thickness on CT scan
Vasospasm risk increases progressively with each grade
Does not apply to traumatic SAH, AVM, or other non-aneurysmal causes
Should be assessed on initial non-contrast head CT
Used in conjunction with clinical assessment for management decisions
Higher grades warrant closer monitoring for delayed cerebral ischemia
